page.title: 04FARMING - INTERVIEW ONE.
page.content: Interview made by children. The lady & gentleman have a farm Map ref.86,35 which covers 253 hectares. The gentleman has lived there all his life and the farm has been worked by his family since 1902. The farmhouse is a Grade II listed building. The middle of the building is stone with walls half metre thick. One room is probably 300 to 400 years old. The most modern part is 100 years old. The front and back of the building is brick with a slate and tile roof.The floors are stone and wood. On their land was the medieval hamlet of Casthorpe known as a 'lost village' because no one lived there after the Black Death. Farm machinery still turns up stones from that time.
